description:
**Software or Senior Software Engineer – Machine Learning** 




  





**Our Firm** 




 CF Corporation is a global leading firm in the human capital and technology space, operating, investing and advising since 1982, operating in 119 countries across our 30 individual companies.
 



  





 Our technology firm, CF Digital is a global technology business that designs and delivers advanced solutions across AI, data, security, and cloud platforms. We build products and systems that help organisations operate more efficiently, make better decisions, and scale with confidence. Working across multiple sectors, we combine deep technical capability with practical commercial understanding – focusing on outcomes, not experimentation for its own sake.
 



  





  





**Your Focus** 




 As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you will design, build, and scale production\\-grade machine learning systems across AI, data, and cloud\\-led platforms.
 



  





 This role sits firmly in product development, not research showcase work. You’ll be responsible for turning models into reliable, performant software that runs in real environments, under real constraints, for real organisations.
 



  





 The focus is on deployable, scalable ML systems – models that integrate cleanly with products, perform efficiently in production, and deliver measurable value. Prototypes are only useful if they survive contact with reality.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 



* Design and implement machine learning systems that operate reliably in production
* Partner with data scientists and engineers to translate models into deployable services
* Optimise training and inference pipelines for performance, cost, and scalability
* Profile, analyse, and improve ML workloads across compute and data pipelines
* Improve end\\-to\\-end ML system efficiency, from data ingestion and feature pipelines to model execution and serving
* Own the production lifecycle of ML components, including monitoring, debugging, and iteration
* Make informed trade\\-offs between model complexity, performance, and operational reality



  





 You can absorb complex technical information quickly, understand problem constraints and system requirements with rigour, and form clear, practical technical decisions. You approach challenges with structure and engineering discipline, and you are comfortable working under pressure as projects evolve and requirements change.
 



  





 You bring pace, resilience, and strong attention to detail, and you work effectively with engineers, data scientists, and domain specialists without excessive direction. You communicate clearly, consider alternative approaches, and use them to improve solution quality and outcomes.
 



  





 This role suits someone who is technically strong, commercially aware, and prepared to be accountable for the robustness, performance, and real\\-world impact of the systems they build.
 



  





  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Ideally a degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related technical discipline
* At least 3\\+ years’ experience building and deploying machine learning or data\\-driven systems
* Experience developing, training, or serving models using modern ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch or similar)
* Experience optimising ML pipelines or inference systems for performance, cost, or scalability
* Solid software engineering fundamentals, including production\\-quality code and testing practices
* Experience training, validating, or serving large\\-scale machine learning models
* Practical understanding of parallelism in ML systems (data, model, or pipeline parallelism)
* Experience profiling and optimising ML workloads, including tuning model performance
* Understanding of the full ML lifecycle, from data preparation and training through to inference and monitoring
* Experience working with distributed or accelerator\\-based ML systems (e.g. GPUs or similar)
* Comfort moving between model\\-level decisions and production system constraints
* Ability to translate real\\-world problems into practical technical solutions



  





 We are open to considering candidates with experience outside of these brackets, if you feel you have the capabilities to deliver on our main criteria.
 



  





 We consider any degree or subject and although your grade indicates your ability to absorb data and apply it, your degree grade does not influence your chance of applying to us and being interviewed.
 



  





  





**Process** 




 This application shall be open for the next seven days for our India office. We prioritise applicants with the right to work in India. If you do not have the right to work in India, you may still apply and we can potentially procure a working permit for you. Bear in mind that we are hiring across many of our global offices and shall post a vacancy for each relevant location, every week. Follow us on LinkedIn to keep up to date on vacancies we post, by location.
 



  





 Your first step is to apply with your LinkedIn profile. We do not require a CV or covering letter, but if there is experience or work that cannot be clearly represented on your LinkedIn profile, you are welcome to share this separately on your application.
 



  





 We aim to respond within two weeks of receiving your application. Due to the volume of applications we receive, we are unfortunately unable to provide individual feedback. You may reapply for the same position after at least 12 months has passed, which we consider as a reasonable period for meaningful professional development to merit reapplying.
 



  





 Successful applicants will be invited to an initial interview with our HR team, followed by a conversation with one of our Technology Partners. We will ask you a series of interpersonal and technical questions, so we can understand how you think, your motivation, and the experience you bring.
 



  





 Subject to the outcome of the initial interviews, the next and final stage involves attending our India office. We typically select ten candidates at this stage. You will take part in exercises that allows us to assess how you interact with people, form solutions and manage ambiguity. You will also meet with two Partners in the firm to further discuss your career aspirations, expertise and discuss scenarios to understand your capacity to think.
 



  





 All reasonable travel and accommodation expenses related to the process will be covered. Feedback is provided at the end of the day, and in some cases an unconditional offer may be made. We have also been known to hire more than one person, depending on capability.
 



  





  





**Reward Structure** 



* An annual base salary of 12,800,000 and up to 26,200,000 Indian Rupees, depending on experience and degree level (Bachelor, Master, PhD)
* Bonus program of on\\-target bonus of 25% of base salary and up to 60% for high\\-achievers inclusive of client originated fees
* Hybrid working is embedded in the fabric of our firm. Depending upon your role, we offer work from home, office or hybrid elsewhere for a period of time
* Full healthcare including dental coverage for self and if you have an immediate family
* Pension program with a non\\-contributory scheme of 12% of base salary per annum and options how your pension is invested with our preferred asset manager
* Relocation is provided by the company for personal items and accommodation for the first three months upon joining, where required
* Opportunity to take one career break for up to six months and use this time for self or other
* You will have a dedicate mentor for your career development pathway, built around real work, feedback, and exposure to senior leaders



  





 This role is designed for people who want pace, exposure, and accountability. Our reward program is structured for those that understand the level of performance required.
